author: parithosh

author: parithosh

author: parithosh
content: I guess this is a win? but potentially with some bug hidden somewhere

author: manunlp
content:
Currently my main suspect for this issue is the logging level of Teku, which kind of "overwhelm" the docker engine.
When analysing the dump you sent yesterday, from Prysm point of view, I see "peer disconnected" of teku nodes.

Prysm is currently not so verbose about peer disconnection reason. (For example, if the peer disconnection is from Prysm initiative, there is no specific log.)
==> I'm adding more logs about peers disconnections in Prysm, and try to reproduce the issue with Teku debug logs.

(I do not reproduce the issue with teku info logs only, but right now I'm not 100% confident of the log level to be the root cause.)

author: manunlp
content:
If you modified the log level from debug to info, you won't see 
```
DEBUG - Failed to fetch blob sidecar by identifier ...
```
logs, since they are debug logs
